availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George S. Welsh (Morgan County, OH, schoolteacher and clerk in court of county common pleas)

body.p: Morgan County, Ohio, schoolteacher and court clerk. Pennsylvania native. Married to Sarah Welsh. Father of Daniel Welsh, Mary Welsh, George Welsh, Martha Welsh, Sarah Welsh, Roger W. Welsh, Clark Welsh, Ida Anna Welsh, Alla G. Welsh. Schoolteacher in Morgan County in 1850. Clerk in McConnelsville in 1860. Clerk of the Common Pleas Court in Morgan County in 1861. Clerk in Morgan County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, Windsor Township, p. 183A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, McConnelsville, p. 301-02.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Morgan County, OH, June 1863, p. 5.
"George St. Clark Welsh (1821-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8751509, accessed August 26, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8751509.
KYR-0001-022-0008.
